cons: Customer service staff are looked down at by other staff within Orbit. Bear in mind min wait times to speak to a customer services representative is 45 minutes - customer is annoyed then they have to be transferred. Training is a joke, less than 2 weeks training, covering very little and given no time to process what has been told - in one ear out the other due to information being read from a power point to you. Orbit Group has a focus of housing for customers yet fails miserably in supporting them. It’s not right that an angry/ upset customer has to wait at 45 minutes to speak to someone and gets verbally aggressive as they are at breaking point to report and wait further for help. 6 months probation and not allowed to move departments until probation passed. No canteen on site. No on-site parking unless you are a manager.

job_title: Head of Marketing & Commuications in Coventry, England
pros: Orbit is inherently a very good organisation; it has strong values and a strong social purpose and it's people are really passionate about making a difference to its customers by putting their needs first. The size of organisation provides opportunity and whilst it does lots of things well there are many opportunities to improve which for a new starter is really appealing as it creates opportunity to shape the future direction of the organisation and impact change. The benefits are very good and the added flexibility of agile working is a real bonus for flexing work patterns to avoid traffic, allow for child care etc.
cons: It is a large organisation with a relatively complex organisational structure which takes a while to get your head around. It also is a bit disorganised and disjointed in places but the the organisational is going through change and this is being addressed. You do need to be someone who can adapt and embrace change though; don't expect everything to be working as it should because it isn't but the opportunity is to play a part in making it better

pros:
Great place to work. Provides excellence benefits (27 Days A/L, upto 15% bonus and flexible working). 

I came in at the junior level and now i'm working at the senior level after 5 years.

Orbit rewards hard work and loyalty.

Currently in the middle of a great transformation program which is bringing much needed change to the organisation, especially with IT. We have received a boost of funds in IT to innovate and improve the digital services we offer to our colleagues and customers.

Exciting times with exciting change.
cons:
People need to be held accountable for their mistakes. Team structures could be more streamlined.

It feels like sometimes management doesn't deal with people who underachieve and put their colleagues workload under extreme pressure.

Team building and days out need to be done.

review_title: Great people, great benefits and a real social purpose
pros:
I have not long started at Orbit and whilst at times it can seem like information overload, there are a number of fantastic schemes aimed directly at making Orbit a great place to work for all employees.

There is no doubting the commitment that Orbit shows to it's customers, employees and the communities that it serves.

If you want to work for a great company in a busy environment with great benefits, great people and a real social purpose then Orbit may just be the place for you.
cons: As with any organisation of this size it can sometimes feel as though there are silos but it appears that these are created naturally through function and location than by design.
